New Records: Muhammad Rizwan's fifty was the slowest for Pakistan in T20 internationals.
Key Match Events: Pakistan won by seven wickets to keep their Super 8s hopes alive.
Canada posted 106-7 with Johnson scoring 52 off 44 balls.
Amir took 2-13 and Rauf took 2-26 for Pakistan.
Pakistan reached 107-3 with 15 balls to spare, with Rizwan hitting 53 not out.
Saim Ayub survived a dropped chance but was dismissed without scoring further runs.
Muhammad Rizwan and Babar Azam put on 63 for the second wicket.
Fakhar Zaman was caught by sub Dilpreet Bajwa off Jeremy Gordon for 4.
Usman Khan hit the winning runs in the 18th over.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan captain Babar Azam emphasized the importance of the win and discussed the pitch conditions.
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar reflected on the difficulties of batting and the positives to take away.
Player of the match Mohammad Amir spoke about adapting to conditions and the importance of the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the highest successful chase at the New York ground.
Pakistan's win helped their net run rate as they finished with 15 balls to spare.
